name: zodipy

name: pgmuvi

name: allesfitter

name: Everest Framework

detailed_description: A pipeline for the automated reduction of spectrophotometric images, designed for rapid processing.

detailed_description: A library for fast and scalable Gaussian Process regression in one dimension, widely used for astronomical time series analysis.

detailed_description: A Python library for Gaussian Process regression, designed for use in astronomy and other scientific fields.

detailed_description: A library that implements interpretable Gaussian processes specifically for modeling stellar light curves, allowing for the inference of surface features.

name: PyFITS

name: astroimtools

detailed_description: A package providing convenience tools for processing and analyzing astronomical images, including cutouts and statistics.

name: imexam

name: jwql

name: stsynphot_refactor

detailed_description: A package for synthetic photometry specifically tailored for HST and JWST, utilizing the Astropy framework to simulate observations.

name: synphot_refactor

detailed_description: A general-purpose package for synthetic photometry using Astropy, allowing users to simulate photometric data from spectra and passbands.

name: Optika

detailed_description: Optika is a Python library designed for simulating optical systems, offering capabilities similar to Zemax. It allows for the modeling of optical components, ray tracing, and analysis of optical performance, suitable for physics and astronomical instrumentation.

name: ndcube
one_line_profile: Multi-dimensional coordinate-aware array library for solar physics
detailed_description: ndcube is a SunPy-affiliated package that provides a base class for handling multi-dimensional contiguous and non-contiguous coordinate-aware arrays. It is designed to handle complex scientific data cubes, particularly in solar physics, integrating data with World Coordinate System (WCS) information.

name: SunPy
one_line_profile: The community-developed open-source software library for solar physics
detailed_description: SunPy is a comprehensive Python library for solar physics data analysis. It provides tools for querying and downloading data from solar missions, loading and visualizing images and time series, and performing coordinate transformations and physical calculations.

name: sunraster
one_line_profile: Tools to analyze spectral data from solar missions
detailed_description: sunraster is a SunPy-affiliated package specifically designed for the analysis of spectral data (raster scans) from solar physics missions. It builds upon ndcube to provide specialized functionality for handling slit-spectrograph data.

name: deepARTransit
one_line_profile: LSTM-based library for interpolating and detrending transit light curves
detailed_description: deepARTransit is a Python library that utilizes Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) neural networks to interpolate and detrend exoplanet transit light curves. It is designed to handle the noise and variability in photometric data to improve transit detection and characterization.

name: pydl
one_line_profile: Library of IDL astronomy routines converted to Python
detailed_description: pydl implements Python replacements for common IDL (Interactive Data Language) routines used in astronomy. It facilitates the transition from IDL to Python for astronomers by providing familiar functionality for data processing and mathematical operations.

name: fourpiskytools

detailed_description: A software package for denoising gravitational wave data and detecting signals, specifically targeted at space-based detection scenarios.

name: Kowalski
one_line_profile: Multi-survey data archive and alert broker for time-domain astronomy
detailed_description: Kowalski is a system for archiving and accessing astronomical data from multiple surveys, specifically designed to handle the high-volume data streams and alert brokering required for time-domain astronomy.

name: Sherlock
one_line_profile: The QUB Transient Classifier for astronomical sources
detailed_description: Sherlock is a transient classifier package designed to cross-match and classify astronomical transients against a massive library of historical catalogs, aiding in the rapid identification of new sources.

name: SFFT
one_line_profile: Saccadic Fast Fourier Transform algorithm for image subtraction
detailed_description: SFFT (Saccadic Fast Fourier Transform) is an algorithm and python tool for efficient image subtraction in Fourier space, a critical step in detecting transient astronomical events by comparing new observations with reference images.

name: ggwd
one_line_profile: Generator for synthetic gravitational-wave data
detailed_description: ggwd is a tool that utilizes PyCBC and LALSuite to generate synthetic gravitational-wave data, facilitating the training and testing of machine learning models for gravitational wave detection.

name: voevent-parse
one_line_profile: Library for parsing and manipulating VOEvent packets
detailed_description: voevent-parse is a Python library built on lxml.objectify for parsing, manipulating, and creating VOEvent packets, which are the standard format for reporting astronomical transient events.

name: Multi-SConES
one_line_profile: Multi-task feature selection for selecting connected explanatory SNPs in GWAS
detailed_description: An R package implementing Multi-SConES, a method for multi-task feature selection coupled with multiple network regularizers, primarily used in bioinformatics for Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS) to identify significant SNPs.

name: RESSPECT
one_line_profile: Recommendation system for telescope resource allocation in supernova cosmology
detailed_description: A Python package developed by the Cosmostatistics Initiative (COIN) and LSST DESC to optimize photometric supernova cosmology analysis through an active learning-based recommendation system for telescope resource allocation.

name: SCONE
one_line_profile: Stochastic Calculator Of Neutron transport Equation
detailed_description: A Fortran-based stochastic calculator for solving the neutron transport equation, used in nuclear physics and engineering for simulating neutron behavior.

name: HOPS
one_line_profile: Software for single-object photometry and exoplanet light-curve modelling
detailed_description: A user-friendly software package designed for analyzing astronomical data, specifically for single-object photometry and modelling the light curves of exoplanets.

name: MUTIS
one_line_profile: Analysis of correlations of light curves and their statistical significance
detailed_description: A Python package from IAA-CSIC for analyzing correlations in astronomical light curves and determining their statistical significance, useful for multi-wavelength studies.

name: pyzdcf
one_line_profile: Estimation of cross-correlation function of astronomical time-series using ZDCF
detailed_description: A Python module for estimating the cross-correlation function of sparse, unevenly sampled astronomical time-series data based on the Z-Transformed Discrete Correlation Function (ZDCF) method.

name: elasticc
one_line_profile: Infrastructure and metrics for the ELAsTiCC astronomical classification challenge
detailed_description: A repository containing settings, configuration, and metric implementations for the Extended LSST Astronomical Time Series Classification Challenge (ELAsTiCC), used for evaluating transient classifiers.

name: parsnip
one_line_profile: Deep generative modeling of astronomical transient light curves
detailed_description: A Python package for deep generative modeling of astronomical transient light curves. It learns a low-dimensional representation of transients that can be used for classification, augmentation, and other analysis tasks.

name: plasticc-kit
one_line_profile: Starter Kit for the Photometric LSST Astronomical Time-series Classification Challenge
detailed_description: A toolkit providing data loaders, metrics, and example notebooks for the Photometric LSST Astronomical Time-series Classification Challenge (PLAsTiCC), facilitating the development of classification models for astronomical transients.

name: snmachine
one_line_profile: Machine learning code for photometric supernova classification
detailed_description: A Python library developed by LSST DESC for photometric supernova classification using various machine learning techniques, designed to process light curves and extract features for classification.

name: Spacetimeformer
one_line_profile: Long-Range Transformers for Dynamic Spatiotemporal Forecasting
detailed_description: A multivariate time series forecasting framework using efficient Transformers, specifically designed to learn long-range dependencies in spatiotemporal data. While general-purpose, it is highly relevant for scientific modeling tasks involving space and time dynamics.

name: VegasAfterglow
one_line_profile: High-performance C++ framework for GRB afterglow modeling
detailed_description: A C++ framework with Python bindings for modeling Gamma-Ray Burst (GRB) afterglows. It features fast multi-wavelength light curve generation, MCMC parameter inference, and advanced physics models including shock dynamics and structured jets.

name: SCoPe-ML
one_line_profile: Machine learning classification pipeline for ZTF sources
detailed_description: The SCoPe (ZTF Source Classification Project) repository contains the machine learning pipeline used for classifying astronomical sources detected by the Zwicky Transient Facility (ZTF).

name: ATAT
one_line_profile: Astronomical Transformer for Time Series and Tabular Data
detailed_description: ATAT is a Transformer-based model designed for processing astronomical time series and tabular data, developed as part of the ALeRCE broker ecosystem for classification and analysis tasks.

name: LC Classifier
one_line_profile: Light Curve Classifier for the ALeRCE Broker
detailed_description: The Light Curve Classifier used by the ALeRCE broker system to classify astronomical alerts based on their photometric time-series data. It includes feature extraction and machine learning classification models.

name: mind_the_gaps
one_line_profile: Gaussian Process analysis tool for irregularly-sampled astronomical time series
detailed_description: A Python library for performing Gaussian Process time series analysis, specifically focused on period detection in irregularly-sampled and stochastically-varying astronomical light curves.

name: gatspy
one_line_profile: General tools for astronomical time series analysis
detailed_description: A library for astronomical time series analysis in Python, providing tools for periodogram analysis (Lomb-Scargle, Supersmoother) and Gaussian Process modeling of light curves.

name: keplersplinev2
one_line_profile: Robust B-spline fitting tool for astronomical light curves
detailed_description: A Python code for robustly fitting a basis spline to data, particularly useful for detrending and analyzing astronomical light curves (e.g., Kepler/K2 data).

name: deepSIP
one_line_profile: Deep learning tool for Supernova Ia parameter estimation
detailed_description: A deep learning framework for estimating parameters of Type Ia Supernovae from optical spectra and light curves.

name: Avocado (Genomics)
one_line_profile: Distributed variant caller for genomics
detailed_description: A distributed variant caller built on top of the ADAM genomics processing engine, designed for calling variants from high-throughput sequencing data.

name: Icarus
one_line_profile: Stellar binary light curve synthesis tool
detailed_description: A tool for synthesizing light curves of stellar binary systems, used for modeling and analyzing binary star data.

name: Astro R-CNN
one_line_profile: Instance segmentation for astronomical images using Mask R-CNN
detailed_description: An implementation of Mask R-CNN adapted for instance segmentation and detection of sources in astronomical images.

name: Deep-LC
one_line_profile: General astrophysical light curve classification package
detailed_description: A Python package designed for the classification of general astrophysical light curves using deep learning techniques.

name: astrodash
one_line_profile: Deep learning for automated spectral classification of supernovae
detailed_description: DASH (Deep Automated Supernova cHaracterization) is a deep learning software for the automated spectral classification of supernovae.

name: SCONES
one_line_profile: Self-Consistent Neural Network for Protein Stability Prediction
detailed_description: A neural network based tool for predicting protein stability changes upon mutations, utilizing a self-consistent representation of the protein environment.

name: AVOCADO
one_line_profile: Adaptive Optimal Collision Avoidance driven by Opinion
detailed_description: A robotics navigation framework implementing an adaptive optimal collision avoidance algorithm driven by opinion dynamics, as presented in IEEE Transactions on Robotics.

name: braai
one_line_profile: Real-bogus astrophysical event classification for ZTF
detailed_description: A deep learning based tool for separating real astrophysical events from bogus detections (artifacts) in Zwicky Transient Facility (ZTF) data.

name: tails
one_line_profile: Deep learning based comet detection for ZTF
detailed_description: A deep learning pipeline designed to identify and chase comets within the Zwicky Transient Facility (ZTF) data stream.

name: lightcurver
one_line_profile: Pipeline for light curve extraction from astronomical images
detailed_description: A pipeline designed for the precise extraction of light curves through forward modelling of regions from time-series wide-field astronomical images.

name: upsilon
one_line_profile: Automated Classification of Periodic Variable Stars
detailed_description: A machine learning library for the automated classification of periodic variable stars using light curve features.

name: AltaiPony
one_line_profile: Flare finding in Kepler and TESS light curves
detailed_description: A Python package for de-trending light curves and finding stellar flares in Kepler, K2, and TESS mission data.

name: jaxoplanet
one_line_profile: Astronomical time series analysis with JAX
detailed_description: A library for probabilistic inference and analysis of astronomical time series (specifically exoplanets) built on top of JAX.

name: kantime
one_line_profile: R bindings for NeuralForecast KAN models
detailed_description: Provides R bindings for Nixtla's neuralforecast library, specifically enabling the use of Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks (KANs) for time series forecasting within the R ecosystem.

name: cosmogrb
one_line_profile: Cosmological GRB light curve simulator
detailed_description: A simulator for generating synthetic light curves of Gamma-Ray Bursts (GRBs) in a cosmological context, useful for testing analysis pipelines.

name: lightcurve_fitting
one_line_profile: Tools to fit analytical models to multiband light curves
detailed_description: A toolkit for fitting analytical models to multiband light curves of astronomical transients, supporting parameter estimation.

name: grtrace
one_line_profile: General Relativity Raytracer
detailed_description: A raytracing tool that simulates light bending in curved spacetimes, allowing for visualization and analysis of general relativity effects.

name: magic-microlensing
one_line_profile: Microlensing Analysis Guided by Intelligent Computation
detailed_description: A PyTorch-based framework for the automatic analysis and modeling of realistic microlensing light curves using neural networks.

name: astroNN
one_line_profile: Deep Learning for Astronomers with Keras
detailed_description: A python package containing deep learning tools and models specifically designed for astronomical applications, including spectroscopy and photometry analysis.

name: PyTransit
one_line_profile: Fast and easy exoplanet transit light curve modelling
detailed_description: A Python package for creating exoplanet transit light curves, offering optimized performance for modelling and analysis of photometric data.

name: Fulu
one_line_profile: Supernova light curve approximation library
detailed_description: A Python library providing machine learning-based methods for approximating and augmenting supernova light curves, useful for handling sparse astronomical time-series data.

name: Avocado (Epigenomics)
one_line_profile: Deep tensor factorization for epigenome imputation
detailed_description: A multi-scale deep tensor factorization model that learns latent representations of the human epigenome to impute missing experiments and analyze epigenomic data.

name: VARTOOLS
one_line_profile: Command line tool for astronomical time series analysis
detailed_description: A program for processing and analyzing astronomical time series data, providing tools for period search, light curve manipulation, and statistics.

name: FATS-2.0
one_line_profile: Feature Analysis for Time Series in Astronomy
detailed_description: A Python library for extracting features from astronomical light curves to facilitate machine learning classification and variability analysis.

name: xSAGA
one_line_profile: Deep learning extension for SAGA galaxy survey
detailed_description: A tool extending the SAGA survey to wide-field regimes using deep learning to identify satellite galaxies around Milky Way analogs.

name: Avocado (Astronomy)
one_line_profile: Photometric classification of astronomical transients
detailed_description: A package for the photometric classification of astronomical transients and variables, featuring data augmentation techniques (Gaussian Process) to handle biased spectroscopic samples.

name: Pyriod
one_line_profile: Period detection and fitting for astronomical time series
detailed_description: A Python tool for identifying periods in astronomical time series data and fitting models to the variability.

name: light-curve
one_line_profile: High-performance time-series feature extraction in Rust
detailed_description: A Rust library for fast and efficient feature extraction from time-series data, specifically designed for astronomical light curves.

name: light-curve-python
one_line_profile: Python bindings for light-curve feature extraction
detailed_description: Python bindings for the 'light-curve' Rust library, enabling fast feature extraction from astronomical light curves within Python workflows.

name: batman
one_line_profile: Fast transit light curve models
detailed_description: A Python package for the calculation of exoplanet transit light curves, known for its speed and flexibility in modelling transit events.

name: LLCaps
one_line_profile: Low-light enhancement for capsule endoscopy
detailed_description: A deep learning model for illuminating low-light capsule endoscopy images using curved wavelet attention and reverse diffusion.

name: lightcurves
one_line_profile: R code for light curve analysis
detailed_description: A collection of R scripts and functions for analyzing light curves, including classification, noisification, and outlier detection.

name: LightCurvesClassifier
one_line_profile: Machine learning classifier for astronomical light curves
detailed_description: A Python package designed for the machine learning-based classification of astronomical objects using their light curve data.

name: ELISa
one_line_profile: Eclipsing binary Learning and Interactive System
detailed_description: A Python-based tool for efficient modeling of light and radial velocity curves of eclipsing binaries, including optimization methods like MCMC.

name: MiraPy
one_line_profile: Deep Learning library for Astronomy
detailed_description: A Python package facilitating the application of deep learning techniques to astronomical data, including light curves and images.

name: AnomalyALeRCE
one_line_profile: Anomaly Detector for ALeRCE broker
detailed_description: A tool for detecting anomalies in astronomical data streams processed by the ALeRCE broker.

name: BTSbot
one_line_profile: Automated supernova identification bot
detailed_description: A multi-modal deep learning system for the automated identification and classification of supernovae from survey data.

name: ExoMiner
one_line_profile: Deep learning for exoplanet validation
detailed_description: A deep learning-based tool for automating the vetting and validation of exoplanet candidates from Kepler and TESS photometry missions.

name: ellc
one_line_profile: Light curve model for transiting exoplanets and eclipsing binary stars
detailed_description: A Fortran/Python tool for modeling light curves of transiting exoplanets and eclipsing binary stars, capable of handling various stellar shapes and limb darkening profiles.

name: pycheops
one_line_profile: Analysis tool for light curves from the ESA Cheops mission
detailed_description: A Python module specifically designed for the analysis of light curve data from the ESA Cheops mission, including detrending and transit fitting capabilities.

name: deepCR
one_line_profile: Deep Learning based cosmic ray removal for astronomical images
detailed_description: A deep learning tool for identifying and removing cosmic rays from astronomical images, offering rapid processing compared to traditional methods.

name: planetplanet
one_line_profile: General photodynamical code for exoplanet light curves
detailed_description: A general photodynamical code designed to model exoplanet light curves, handling planet-planet interactions and other dynamical effects.

name: lcviz
one_line_profile: Interactive light curve visualization tool for Jdaviz
detailed_description: A visualization tool built on the Jdaviz framework, designed specifically for viewing and analyzing astronomical light curves, supported by STScI.

name: SuperNNova
one_line_profile: Photometric classification of supernovae using Deep Learning
detailed_description: An open-source framework for photometric classification of supernovae using deep learning techniques (RNNs, Bayesian NNs, CNNs), designed for large-scale surveys.

name: SCONE Core
one_line_profile: Open source software for predictive simulation of biological motion
detailed_description: SCONE is a software framework for performing predictive simulations of human and animal motion. It is designed to optimize neuromuscular controllers for musculoskeletal models.

name: SCONE Studio
one_line_profile: Graphical User Interface for the SCONE simulation framework
detailed_description: SCONE Studio provides a GUI for setting up, running, and analyzing predictive simulations of biological motion using the SCONE core library.

name: Sconegym
one_line_profile: OpenAI Gym environments for SCONE biomechanics simulations
detailed_description: Provides Reinforcement Learning environments for musculoskeletal simulations, bridging the SCONE simulator with standard RL algorithms.

name: Time-Series-Library
one_line_profile: Comprehensive library for advanced deep time series analysis models
detailed_description: A state-of-the-art library containing implementations of various deep learning models (Transformers, MLP, CNNs) for time series forecasting, classification, anomaly detection, and imputation.

name: baguette
one_line_profile: Parsnip model wrappers for bagging ensembles
detailed_description: Part of the tidymodels ecosystem, providing efficient implementations for bagging (bootstrap aggregating) models, including trees and MARS.

name: bonsai
one_line_profile: Parsnip wrappers for advanced tree-based models
detailed_description: An extension to the parsnip package in R, providing bindings for LightGBM and Partykit tree models for statistical learning.

name: censored
one_line_profile: Parsnip engines for survival analysis models
detailed_description: Provides a unified interface for survival analysis models within the tidymodels framework, enabling time-to-event prediction.

name: discrim
one_line_profile: Parsnip wrappers for discriminant analysis models
detailed_description: Enables discriminant analysis and Naive Bayes models within the tidymodels ecosystem for classification tasks.

name: multilevelmod
one_line_profile: Parsnip bindings for multilevel and hierarchical models
detailed_description: Provides an interface for fitting mixed-effects and hierarchical models (e.g., lme4, nlme) using the parsnip syntax.

name: poissonreg
one_line_profile: Parsnip wrappers for Poisson regression models
detailed_description: Extensions for parsnip to handle Poisson regression and other count data models.

name: rules
one_line_profile: Parsnip bindings for rule-based models
detailed_description: Provides infrastructure for rule-based classification and regression models (like C5.0 and Cubist) within tidymodels.

name: pylightcurve
one_line_profile: Python package for modeling and analyzing transit light-curves
detailed_description: A tool for modeling exoplanet transits and analyzing their light curves, including limb darkening and orbit calculation.

name: VBBinaryLensing
one_line_profile: C++ library for microlensing light curve calculation
detailed_description: A code for computing magnification of gravitational microlensing events caused by binary lens systems, using the VBB (Valerio Bozza Binary) method.

name: fastdup
one_line_profile: Tool for insights, quality control, and deduplication of image/video datasets
detailed_description: A scalable tool for analyzing large visual datasets to identify duplicates, anomalies, and quality issues, essential for curating scientific image datasets (e.g., in astronomy or biology).

name: astrobase
one_line_profile: Python modules for light curve work and variable star astronomy
detailed_description: A collection of Python modules for analyzing light curves, performing period finding, and other tasks related to variable star astronomy.

name: Astronet-Triage
one_line_profile: Neural Network for TESS Light Curve Triage
detailed_description: A deep learning model and tool designed to triage light curves from the TESS mission, identifying potential transit candidates.

name: TOM Toolkit Base
one_line_profile: Base framework for building Target and Observation Managers (TOMs) in astronomy
detailed_description: The TOM Toolkit is a framework designed to help astronomers build Target and Observation Managers (TOMs). It provides a standardized interface for managing astronomical targets, planning observations, and interfacing with various observatories and data archives.

name: simsurvey
one_line_profile: Simulation package for astronomical survey cadence and strategy evaluation
detailed_description: Simsurvey is a python package for simulating light curves of transient events (like supernovae) based on a survey strategy (cadence, depth, etc.). It helps astronomers evaluate the efficiency of different observing strategies for detecting specific types of transients.

name: ztf_sim
one_line_profile: Scheduler and simulation tools for the Zwicky Transient Facility (ZTF)
detailed_description: This repository contains the scheduling algorithms and simulation tools used for the Zwicky Transient Facility (ZTF). It allows for the planning of survey observations and the simulation of survey performance.

name: QUBO-Chimera
one_line_profile: Software solver for D-Wave's native QUBO problems on Chimera graph topologies
detailed_description: A testbed and solver to evaluate how effectively D-Wave's native Quadratic Unconstrained Binary Optimization (QUBO) problems can be solved in software, specifically targeting the Chimera graph topology used in quantum annealers.

name: MATRIX
one_line_profile: Distributed data-aware execution fabric for high-performance scientific computing
detailed_description: MATRIX is a distributed data-aware execution fabric supporting both high-performance computing (HPC) and many-task computing (MTC) workloads. It is designed to handle scientific workflows in fields like bioinformatics and astronomy by optimizing data locality and task scheduling.

name: tilepy
one_line_profile: Observation scheduling tool for tiling poorly localized transient events
detailed_description: Tilepy is a tool designed for observation scheduling in poorly localized events, such as gravitational wave follow-ups. It helps determine the optimal tiling strategy to cover the probability map of the event.

name: astroplan
one_line_profile: Observation planning and scheduling library for astronomers
detailed_description: Astroplan is an open source Python package to help astronomers plan observations. It provides tools for calculating rise/set times, moon phases, and creating observing schedules for targets at specific observatories.

name: Chimera
one_line_profile: Distributed observatory automation and control system
detailed_description: Chimera is an observatory automation system that provides a distributed framework for controlling telescopes, cameras, and other astronomical instruments. It enables remote operation and automated observation scripts.

name: ZetaPersei
one_line_profile: Observation planning tools for Keck NIRC2 Polarimetry Mode
detailed_description: Software tools designed for science and calibration observation planning specifically for the NIRC2 Polarimetry Mode at the Keck Observatory.

name: obsplan
one_line_profile: Python package for astronomical observation planning and scheduling
detailed_description: A Python package designed to assist in the planning of astronomical observations, likely providing utilities for visibility calculation, scheduling, and constraint checking.

name: Tapir
one_line_profile: Tools for planning astronomical observations including transit visibility and airmass plots
detailed_description: A set of tools designed to aid astronomers in planning observations, featuring capabilities for calculating transit visibility, generating airmass plots, and creating finding charts.

name: RemoteObservatory
one_line_profile: Control system for astronomical observatories
detailed_description: A software system designed to control astronomical observatory hardware, facilitating remote operation and potentially automated observation scheduling.

name: Sauron
one_line_profile: Robotic observatory system for converting devices into automated telescopes
detailed_description: An open source project aimed at converting phones, cameras, or telescopes into robotic observatory systems, enabling automated data acquisition for astronomy.

name: obsy
one_line_profile: Open Observatory Management System
detailed_description: A management system for astronomical observatories, likely handling tasks such as equipment control, environmental monitoring, and observation scheduling.

name: icare
one_line_profile: Custom frontend and backend layer for SkyPortal for the Grandma collaboration
detailed_description: A customized extension of the SkyPortal platform, providing specific features for the Grandma collaboration to manage astronomical transients and coordinate follow-up observations.

name: growth-too-marshal
one_line_profile: Target of Opportunity Marshal for the GROWTH collaboration
detailed_description: A web-based portal (Marshal) used by the GROWTH collaboration to manage Target of Opportunity (ToO) triggers, filter transient candidates, and schedule follow-up observations.

name: Tomographic-Reconstruction
one_line_profile: Computed Tomography (CT) Reconstruction toolkit
detailed_description: A toolkit for Computed Tomography (CT) reconstruction, implementing algorithms such as Radon transforms, filtered back projection, and Fourier methods for scientific imaging.

name: OCS
one_line_profile: Observatory Control System
detailed_description: Software for controlling astronomical observatory equipment, likely including telescope mounts and cameras.

name: ObservationTools
one_line_profile: Tools for planning astronomical observations
detailed_description: A collection of utilities to assist in the planning of astronomical observations, likely including visibility checks and coordinate calculations.

name: pychimera
one_line_profile: Python interface for UCSF Chimera molecular visualization system
detailed_description: A tool that enables the use of the UCSF Chimera Python API within a standard Python interpreter, facilitating automation and scripting for molecular modeling and visualization.

name: asterope-scala-legacy
one_line_profile: Astronomy charting and observation planning application
detailed_description: Legacy Scala codebase for Asterope, an application for astronomy charting, observation planning, ephemeris calculation, and image processing.

name: AstroMosaic
one_line_profile: Web-based telescope planner for mosaic observations
detailed_description: A web tool for visually planning astronomical observations, specifically designed for calculating coordinates for mosaic imaging.

name: snex2
one_line_profile: Updated Supernova Exchange built with TOM Toolkit
detailed_description: The Supernova Exchange platform, built using the TOM (Target and Observation Manager) Toolkit, used by the Global Supernova Project for managing supernova data and observations.

name: GotoPiScope
one_line_profile: Raspberry Pi-based telescope control system
detailed_description: An advanced telescope control system running on Raspberry Pi, designed to automate astronomical observations and provide precision control.

name: legacy_sims_featureScheduler
one_line_profile: Telescope scheduler optimizing observing strategy using basis functions
detailed_description: A telescope scheduling tool developed for LSST simulations that uses basis functions computed from features to optimize observing strategies.

name: rubin_sim
one_line_profile: Scheduler and survey strategy simulation tools for Rubin Observatory
detailed_description: A set of tools for the Rubin Observatory to simulate the scheduler, analyze survey strategies, and perform other related simulations to optimize observation plans.

name: m4opt
one_line_profile: Multi-Mission Multi-Messenger Observation Planning Toolkit
detailed_description: A toolkit designed for planning observations across multiple missions and messengers, facilitating the scheduling of astronomical observations.

name: tom
one_line_profile: Toolkit for Observable Operator Modeling
detailed_description: A C++ library for learning and using Observable Operator Models (OOMs), which are used for modeling stochastic processes.

name: AGFusion
one_line_profile: Gene fusion annotation and visualization tool
detailed_description: A Python package used to annotate and visualize gene fusions, providing insights into the protein domains and functional consequences of fusion events.

name: SPOT
one_line_profile: Site Planning and Observation Tool for NAOJ
detailed_description: A software tool used for site planning and observation scheduling, specifically developed for the National Astronomical Observatory of Japan (NAOJ).

name: OpenSPIFe
one_line_profile: Integrated planning and scheduling toolkit for space exploration
detailed_description: The Open Scheduling and Planning Interface for Exploration (OpenSPIFe) is a toolkit developed by NASA for planning and scheduling space exploration missions.

name: dorado-scheduling
one_line_profile: Observation planning and scheduling simulations for Dorado
detailed_description: Simulation tools for observation planning and scheduling for the Dorado mission. Note: Replaced by m4opt but remains a valid historical tool.

name: yacrd
one_line_profile: Chimeric read detector for long-read sequencing
detailed_description: A tool for detecting chimeric reads in long-read sequencing data (PacBio, Nanopore), performing quality control and filtering.

name: ChiDG
one_line_profile: Chimera-based discontinuous Galerkin solver
detailed_description: A discontinuous Galerkin solver built on the Chimera grid scheme, likely used for computational fluid dynamics (CFD) or similar physics simulations.

name: adaptive_scheduler
one_line_profile: Adaptive scheduling software for astronomical observations
detailed_description: A scheduling component for the Observatory Control System (OCS), designed to adaptively schedule astronomical observations.

name: Cassiopee
one_line_profile: CFD pre- and post-processing modules
detailed_description: A set of Python modules for pre- and post-processing in Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD), handling mesh manipulation and solution analysis.

name: POCS
one_line_profile: PANOPTES Observatory Control System
detailed_description: The Observatory Control System for the PANOPTES citizen-science project, designed to automate the finding of transiting exoplanets.

name: obsplanning
one_line_profile: Tools for planning astronomical observations
detailed_description: A Python package providing tools to assist in the planning of astronomical observations.

name: observing-suite
one_line_profile: Suite for planning and carrying out astronomical observations
detailed_description: A suite of tools built on astropy and inspired by astroplan for planning and executing astronomical observations.

name: SkyPortal
one_line_profile: Collaborative platform for time-domain astronomy
detailed_description: A web-based platform for managing, visualizing, and collaborating on time-domain astronomy data, including transient detection and follow-up.

name: EOSSP
one_line_profile: Earth Observation Satellite Scheduling Problem solver
detailed_description: A planning software for the Earth Observation Satellite Scheduling Problem (EOSSP), developed as part of a PhD thesis.

name: chimeraviz

detailed_description: chimeraviz is an R package designed to automate the creation of visualizations for chimeric RNA, aiding in the analysis of gene fusions and RNA-sequencing data. It supports importing data from various fusion-finder tools and creating circle plots, cytoband plots, and other visualizations.

name: VSEARCH
one_line_profile: High-throughput sequence analysis tool for microbiome data
detailed_description: VSEARCH is a versatile open-source tool for processing metagenomic and microbiome data. It performs tasks such as sequence alignment, clustering, chimera detection, dereplication, and taxonomy assignment, designed as a free, open-source alternative to USEARCH.

name: ActSNClass

detailed_description: A tool implementing active learning strategies specifically for the classification of supernova photometric light curves, aiming to optimize training data selection.

name: xkn

detailed_description: A Python framework dedicated to the computation and modeling of light curves associated with kilonova events.

name: wise_light_curves

detailed_description: A Python package facilitating the retrieval and exploration of light curve data from the WISE (Wide-field Infrared Survey Explorer) mission.

name: dia_pipe
one_line_profile: Difference Image Analysis pipeline for LSST DESC
detailed_description: A pipeline for Difference Image Analysis (DIA) built upon the LSST DM Science Pipelines, developed for the Dark Energy Science Collaboration (DESC) data challenges.

name: MultimodalUniverse
one_line_profile: Large-Scale Multimodal Dataset of Astronomical Data
detailed_description: A large-scale multimodal dataset designed for astronomical research, facilitating the development of machine learning models for astronomy.

name: SARS-CoV2-mRNA-Assemblies
one_line_profile: Assemblies of putative SARS-CoV2 spike-encoding mRNA sequences
detailed_description: A dataset providing experimental sequence information and assemblies for the RNA components of COVID-19 vaccines (Moderna and Pfizer/BioNTech).

name: TSB-UAD
one_line_profile: End-to-end benchmark suite for univariate time-series anomaly detection
detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmark suite for evaluating time-series anomaly detection algorithms, featuring datasets from multiple domains including space science (NASA) and providing a unified interface for model comparison.

name: Avocado
one_line_profile: Photometric classification of astronomical transients and variables
detailed_description: A package for photometric classification of astronomical transients and variables, particularly designed for handling biased spectroscopic samples and data augmentation.

name: sncosmo
one_line_profile: Library for supernova cosmology analysis and modeling
detailed_description: A Python library for supernova cosmology, providing tools for light curve simulation, fitting, and cosmological parameter estimation.
